image.altText: A woman with long black hair in a teal dress stands smiling with a modern building on a green hill in the background.

props.synopsis: In Australian politics it is often said that when Labor governments lose they lose big, but even after 23 years in power, ACT Labor is nowhere close to that fate, making the task before Canberra Liberals leader Elizabeth Lee fundamentally different.

title.children: Elizabeth Lee's task on ACT election day is a big one â€” just like some of her promises

image.altText: A concrete building reading "Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory", with the Australian, ACT and Aboriginal flags.

props.synopsis: New court documents have revealed disturbing allegations about a Canberra man's violent attacks on his heavily pregnant partner, including that he also attacked the couple's seven-year-old child.

title.children: Canberra man who allegedly kicked heavily pregnant partner in stomach denied bail over 'gratuitous violence'

image.altText: Big sign saying Australian National University.

props.synopsis: The Australian National University has yet to confirm how many jobs will be lost nor who will be impacted, but confirmed a major restructure would take place.

title.children: ANU to cut jobs and spending as it faces $200 million deficit

image.altText: Josh Papalii pictured in action for the Raiders.

props.synopsis: Canberra Raiders star player Josh Papalii is expected to be charged after allegedly throwing glasses and verbally abusing staff at the Raiders Gungahlin club last month, and threatening and intimidating police when they told him to leave.

title.children: Canberra Raiders star Josh Papalii to be charged over alleged Mad Monday incident

image.altText: A government building with a coat of arms on the left and the words 'ACT government' on the right.

props.synopsis: On some buildings, the swans are around the wrong way, with a white swan on the left and a black swan on the right.

title.children: ACT government acknowledges coat of arms has been 'incorrectly' displayed

image.altText: A commuter train moving along the tracks.

props.synopsis: The ACT and NSW governments announce they'll work together on improving the railway line between Canberra and Sydney, but this is not a new subject for either.

title.children: Railway between Canberra and Sydney has long been an issue, and it's among Labor's pre-election promises

image.altText: A group of people, some wearing kiffeyeh and some with Palestine flags, stand smiling outside NSW court.

props.synopsis: Pro-Palestinian events for Sunday and Monday in Sydney will go ahead, after both NSW Police and organisers reached a late agreement in the background of a Supreme Court hearing.

title.children: Pro-Palestinian events in Sydney's CBD on Sunday and Monday to go ahead after last-minute agreement with police

image.altText: A multicoloured coin with Countdown written in the middle and the number 50.

props.synopsis: The coins went on sale at 8:30am this morning, but some keen collectors have been in the queue since yesterday evening.

title.children: 'Do yourself a favour' and get to the Mint as it releases commemorative Countdown coin

image.altText: Strikes

props.synopsis: US President Joe Biden says he has discussed possible Israeli strikes on Iranian oil facilities, with his comments causing a spike in oil prices.

title.children: US is 'discussing' possible Israeli strikes on Iran oil facilities, as Israel warns southern Lebanon residents to evacuate

image.altText: Joe Biden looks straight ahead with stern expression, holding one hand in a balled up fist

props.synopsis: The White House has been urged to speed up sharing of sensitive military technology with Australia, agreed under the AUKUS deal, so the nations can jointly develop future weapons.Â

title.children: Biden urged to speed up sensitive military exports to Australia over 'grave and imminent' China threat

image.altText: A balcony overlooking water.

props.synopsis: Queensland authorities are probing the fees residents are charged to sell retirement villas, following an ABC investigation into the multi-billion-dollar sector.

title.children: State government to probe retirement village provider's close ties to real estate company

image.altText: Dental xray illuminated on a light screen.

props.synopsis: A new report shows many Australians are delaying dentist visits or waiting years to receive publicly funded care â€” and in some parts of the country, wait times are going up.

title.children: Thousands of Australians are hospitalised for potentially preventable dental conditions, report shows

image.altText: An artist's illustration shows an apartment complex full of activity.

props.synopsis: Artist renderings of public housing built by a proposed government-owned developer have been released by the Greens â€” as well as their $40 billion price tag.

title.children: The Greens say you could live in this 'beautiful' home, but the scheme would cost taxpayers $40b

image.altText: A series of photos of someone in a kitchen, taken from ground level

props.synopsis: Without even entering the building, we were able to silently peer through the camera on a Deebot device made by Chinese giant Ecovacs.

title.children: The world's largest home robotics company has a problem â€“ its vacuum cleaners can be hacked from afar

image.altText: Tech graphic

props.synopsis: Ever received a scam text from Australia Post while you're waiting for a package? Or a fake toll notice after you've driven on a toll road? Experts say data collected by the online advertising industry could be behind it.

title.children: The completely legal trick scammers can exploit to target millions of Australians

image.altText: David Crisafulli and Steven Miles debating on Channel Nine

props.synopsis: Facing off for the first time in an election leaders debate, LNP leader David Crisafulli vows to quit within four years if he fails to reduce the number of victims of crime in Queensland.

title.children: LNP leader hangs his future on crime victims in first Queensland election debate

image.altText: A for sale sign out the front of an apartment building.

props.synopsis: We asked three experts for their tips to first home buyers. This is what they said.Â

title.children: House prices are on the rise but these experts say there's still room for first home buyers

image.altText: Flames burn on the outside of a multi-storey building as black smoke rises from the scene

props.synopsis: Typhoon Krathon has killed two people and injured more than 100 others in Taiwan, after displacing 5,000 in the Philippines earlier in the week.

title.children: Nine people killed in hospital fire in Taiwan as typhoon sweeps across the country

image.altText: Image of a coal mine from above with what appears to be activity

props.synopsis: A coal mining group with former links to a US fraudster denies claims of illegal mining, and destroying koala habitat without federal approval. Environment groups are doubling down, and want immediate action.

title.children: 'This is illegal coal mining': Koala habitat cleared without federal approval by company previously linked to fraudster

image.altText: A sign saying 'Ashley Youth Detention Centre' outside some fencing.

props.synopsis: A plan to build five facilities with a "therapeutic" approach to youth detention â€” to fill the gap when Tasmania's Ashley youth prison closes â€” appears to have been placed on the backburner, with the minister insisting it's not about cost.

title.children: Ashley Youth prison replacement plan shelved as Tasmanian government looks to fund existing services

image.altText: Tourists take photos amongst statues of the ancient temple.

props.synopsis: As the federal government pursues closer economic ties with Indonesia, studies of the country's language and culture are on the decline across Australia.

title.children: Elite school faces criticism from Indonesian government over axing of language program

image.altText: Pauline David being lifted onto an accessible taxi

props.synopsis: Pauline David had to sleep in her wheelchair after an accessible taxi failed to arrive to take her home. She's one of many people with a disability struggling to maintain independence as the number of accessible cabs in NSW declines.Â

title.children: Pauline was forced to sleep in her wheelchair when an accessible taxi failed to turn up

image.altText: A guy in a suit and tie sits in a room during an interview.

props.synopsis: The Tasmanian Labor party has endured four straight state election losses, surfacing from the latest with a new leader. Can Dean Winter turn that around?

title.children: Tasmanian Labor wants to win majority government. What does the party's road to leadership look like?

image.altText: Dolphin warning poster

props.synopsis: Over recent months, there have been multiple reports of a lone dolphin attacking swimmers. Why is it happening and what are authorities saying?

title.children: Lone dolphin appears to be behind series of 'attacks' on Japanese swimmers

image.altText: Sign of the times

props.synopsis: Researchers have found 23,000 Australians over the age of 15 have been displaced by floods, bushfires or cyclones on average every year since 2009.

title.children: More Australians expected to be displaced by flooding, fires and cyclones as urban footprint grows

image.altText: A hydrogen container with a warning sign about flammable gas.Â

props.synopsis: A project held up as a flagship for Australia's fledgling green hydrogen industry loses its biggest backer as Origin Energy abandons plans for the fuel.

title.children: Hopes for green hydrogen fading as energy giant Origin walks away from flagship project

image.altText: Jayson Gillham sits on a step outside in a professional portrait photo

props.synopsis:
Jayson Gillham files a statement of claim in Federal Court after the Melbourne Symphony Orchestra cancelled one of his performances over comments he made on stage about the war in Gaza.

Â

title.children: Pianist launches legal action against Melbourne Symphony Orchestra over Gaza comments controversy

image.altText: Nicola Gobbo, known as Lawyer X, wearing a leopard print top stares out a window

props.synopsis: In evidence in her civil lawsuit against the State of Victoria, lawyer turned police informer Nicola Gobbo says Victoria Police made frequent threats to strip her children from her custody if she did not comply with their orders.

title.children: 'I'm tired and broken': Nicola Gobbo details life in limbo and under police control in court

image.altText: Joe Daniher of the Lions during the AFL grand final, looking up at the crowd

props.synopsis: Brisbane forward Joe Daniher has announced his retirement from the AFL, just days after helping the Lions win the grand final.

title.children: Lions premiership star Joe Daniher announces retirement

image.altText: Two dingoes walking through the wide open cage

props.synopsis: The Shire of Murchison says it's "unlikely" two popular pet dingoes on farmstay Wooleen Station were shot under its bounty system.

title.children: Council defends dingo bounty after disappearance of two 'pets' helping station's conservation effort

image.altText: Brightly coloured cells and neurons show the structure of a fruit fly brain that has been mapped for the first time.

props.synopsis: The research sought to decipher how brains are wired and the signals underlying healthy brain functions. It also could pave the way for mapping the brains of other species.

title.children: Scientists have mapped a fruit fly's brain. It's a neurobiological milestone

image.altText: A composite photo of Victorian opposition leader John Pesutto and former Liberal MP Moira Deeming.Â

props.synopsis:
The defamation trial between Opposition Leader John Pesutto and ousted Liberal MP Moira Deeming has heard a secret recording taken by Ms Deeming where she denied being transphobic or homophobic in a meeting with senior Liberals.

Â

title.children: Another secret recording aired in Deeming-Pesutto defamation trial â€“ this time made by Moira Deeming

image.altText: Nina Korbe wears a red velvet formal gown with a black silk cape and sings into a microphone on stage with a broad smile.

props.synopsis: With an aim to advance equality in the music industry, winners at this year's Australian Women in Music Awards have been celebrated in Brisbane.

title.children: Dame Joan Sutherland and 'Little Pattie' Amphlett among the trailblazers recognised at Australian Women in Music Awards

image.altText: Iran's supreme leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei

props.synopsis: Iran's "Axis of Resistance" is dedicated to countering US and Israeli influence in the Middle East. Here's a look at the group's key players and their roles in the current conflict.

title.children: What is Iran's so-called Axis of Resistance?

image.altText: Tamak Vijay walking outside of court with his hand near his mouth. A reporter's microphone can be seen on the left.

props.synopsis: A driving assessor indecently touched young women as they were taking their licence tests, instructing one to park on a deserted street where he placed his hand on her thigh, a Perth court has been told.

title.children: City councillor on trial after allegedly indecently assaulting women while working as driving instructor
